column4: Hi guys. I'm got a button that told me to use package manager or apt-get, and when I did so I received this error message.

netrunnerblack@GothixMindsEyeIII:~$ sudo apt-get check [sudo] password for netrunnerblack: Reading package lists... Error! E: Encountered a section with no Package: header E: Problem with MergeList /var/lib/apt/lists/archive.ubuntulinux.jp_ubuntu-ja_precise_en E: The package lists or status file could not be parsed or opened.
what version of ubuntu are you using ?
did you run any command to update your sources list recently ?
I've added source packages in the past though, should I update again?
Have you tried to find a match on google for your problem
have you tried to remove those packages from your sources list
1) No, but I'm using DuckDuckGo. 2) No, I'm a bit of a newb at all this and didn't want to break something. ^^
Well first open the sources list, wherever it is on 12.04
Sorry. Okay, I've found the file referanced.
